pageTextData.description: First introduced in 1961, crisp, refreshing, clean-tasting Sprite is now the world's leading lemon and lime flavoured soft drink and is sold in more than 190 different countries. Sprite Zero, part of our no sugar Zero range, offers the delicious lemon lime taste of Sprite without the sugar or calories.

pageTextData.title: Appletiser
pageTextData.subTitle: South Africa, 1966
pageTextData.description: Appletiser is a sparkling fruit juice created by blending fruit juice with carbonated water. It was created in 1966 in Elgin Valley, Western Cape, South Africa, by French-Italian immigrant Edmond Lombardi. For export and out of season, the juice is concentrated by extracting the aroma and the water from it.

pageTextData.title: History of Coca Cola
pageTextData.subTitle: Atlanta Beginnings
pageTextData.description: It was 1886, and in New York Harbour, workers were constructing the Statue of Liberty. Eight hundred miles away, another great American symbol was about to be unveiled. Like many people who change history, John Pemberton, an Atlanta pharmacist, was inspired by simple curiosity. One afternoon, he stirred up a fragrant, caramel-coloured liquid and, when it was done, he carried it a few doors down to Jacobs' Pharmacy. Here, the mixture was combined with carbonated water and sampled by customers who all agreed - this new drink was something special. So Jacobs' Pharmacy put it on sale for five cents (about 3p) a glass.

pageTextData.AboutText: CocaCola logo links to the homepage. Restyled to website. Nav buttons class ‘active’ now updates to display the actual open page. Flickr web service tool as a search feature.  Added a video to the about page (text gotten through getJsonData.js). All links that take you outside of the website (eg github and coca cola website) will open in a new tab instead. Created links to company websites for footer social icons. Also removed Google+ as it has been shut down. When downloading the x3d models, make sure to unzip the folder first to see them with materials - also, the animations will not work when downloaded as it's enabled throught the website code.
